alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 3:12PM EDT until June 26 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL SUSSEX...NORTHWESTERN WARREN...EAST CENTRAL MONROE AND NORTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 312 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Columbia, or 16 miles northeast of Easton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Blairstown, Belvidere, Hope, East Bangor, Flatbrookville, Werry Lake, Millbrook, Delaware Water Gap, Columbia, Echo Lake, Five Points, Portland, Shawnee, Marshalls Creek and Hidden Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 12. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
